Don't include all private information, such as ID and date of birth. Use ___ to represent names of patients and medical professionals.

[Patient Name]  
[Patient Address]  
[City, State, ZIP Code]  

Date: February 14, 2024  

Dear [Patient Name],  

This letter serves as a summary of your recent hospital stay from February 10, 2024, to February 14, 2024, at [Hospital Name]. Your primary physician was Dr. Smith. You were admitted to the hospital with symptoms including cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, and fever, which warranted a thorough examination and investigation of your condition.  

Upon admission, you were diagnosed with lobar pneumonia, unspecified organism (Diagnosis Code: J18.1). An initial chest X-ray indicated consolidation in the left lower lobe of your lung, confirming the diagnosis. Your condition was classified under the DRG Code 193 for simple pneumonia and pleurisy with a major complication or comorbidity (MCC).  

At the onset of your admission, your vital signs showed a temperature of 38.5°C, heart rate of 90 bpm, blood pressure of 130/85 mmHg, respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation at 92%. Laboratory tests revealed a C-reactive protein (CRP) level of 60 mg/L, a white blood cell (WBC) count of 12 x10^9/L, hemoglobin at 13.5 g/dL, and platelets at 250 x10^9/L.  

Empirical antibiotic therapy was initiated promptly, with intravenous administration of Amoxicillin at a dose of 500 mg every 8 hours.
